reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2020
reviews.name: E. Debris
reviews.title: Solid CPU
reviews.review: I got this for a media server because of the built in graphics. Been running constantly for over a year with no problems. Solid bit of hardware.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on September 16, 2020
reviews.name: Chanah
reviews.title: Better getting newer ryzen
reviews.review: With ryzen 4000 out I can no longer recommend this cpu. The newer generation outperforms this by 2x.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on June 22, 2020
reviews.name: DavidRinLincoln
reviews.title: Budget gaming
reviews.review: This processor is very good for the folk that don't want to spend 200 dollars for a good graphics card right now.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on May 13, 2020
reviews.name: KJO
reviews.title: fastest pc build ever
reviews.review: works great with dual monitors for autocad and general surfing. pc case looks empty without graphics card

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on May 9, 2020
reviews.name: Ted C.
reviews.title: Amazing
reviews.review: Love how i can hold 120 fbs with out a graphics card. The Vega graphics are amazing

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on April 27, 2020
reviews.name: Eric Arcieri
reviews.title: Value is fantastic
reviews.review: Driver support for Radeon is typically sub par, at the moment the drivers aren't terrible. I do like the 3400g better for it's improved ipc and memory support. But with that said I was pleasantly surprised with how much power the built-in Vega graphics are in this chip.

reviews.review_data: Reviewed in the United States on April 2, 2020
reviews.name: RD Prickett
reviews.title: Great for graphics work
reviews.review: Just did my first pc build 6mo ago, went with linux (Zorin OS). Mainly for graphic design work, with a little light gaming on the side. I can see why Ryzens are taking off, awesome value and performance. This thing is still a little on the underpowered side for some of the work I do, but not a deal breaker. I went with this for the built-in graphics to start with, and planned to add a gpu later on. My buddy just gave me an old gtx 660 he had lying around, so it got a small upgrade already. If you need serious graphics and/or multi-thread computing power, go with a Ryzen a tier or two up. But for typical computing (and then some) this thing is fantastic. AMD all the way.

reviews.review: It's pretty good and the integration graphics is not bad. Preferably, you want a dedicated graphics but it still handled fine without it
